conclusion: Consider the forces acting on each object to determine the outcome when objects A and B move through the air and are placed down at the location of objects C, D, E, F.
Objects A and B will experience air resistance as they move through the air.
Objects C, D, E, F will experience the force of gravity as they are placed down.
Objects A and B will experience a force of gravity proportional to their mass and the acceleration due to gravity.
Objects C, D, E, F will experience the same force of gravity as objects A and B.
The force of gravity acting on objects A and B is directed downward and has a magnitude equal to the weight of the object.
The force of gravity acting on objects C, D, E, F is directed downward and has a magnitude equal to the weight of the object.
Objects A and B will experience air resistance proportional to their velocity and drag coefficient.
Objects C, D, E, F will experience the same force of air resistance as objects A and B.
The force of air resistance acting on objects A and B is directed downward and has a magnitude equal to the drag coefficient times the velocity.
The force of air resistance acting on objects C, D, E, F is directed downward and has a magnitude equal to the drag coefficient times the velocity.
For objects A and B, the force of gravity is greater than the force of air resistance.
For objects C, D, E, F, the force of gravity is equal to the force of air resistance.
Objects A and B will move downward due to the force of gravity.
Objects C, D, E, F will remain stationary due to the force of air resistance.
